security: Disclosing cover considerations for Harold F. Swenson while he remains overseas could expose sensitive operational details. Quoting directly, "as long as Mr. Swenson remains overseas, there are cover considerations instead."
summary: A memo regarding the presentation of a retirement medallion to Harold F. Swenson, requiring a check for any cover considerations due to his CIA service.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential memorandum, dated December 18, 1967, discusses the presentation of a retirement medallion to Harold F. Swenson, who retired after fifteen or more years of CIA service. It includes a request from Laurence G. Parr, Chief of the Employee Activity Branch, to James W. Franklin, Chief of the Central Cover Staff, to check for any cover considerations due to Swenson's overseas status; the reply indicates that cover considerations are indeed in place as long as Swenson remains overseas.
title: SWENSON, Harold F.
